Boston.com
10

Reebok cuts 65 jobs at Canton site, 150 worldwide

The layoffs come after Reebok’s parent company, Adidas AG, slashed its long-term sales forecast at Reebok from about $3.9 billion in 2015 to $2.6 billion. (Globe, 2:46 p.m.)
  • 9/21 Reebok to sharpen its focus as a fitness brand
  • 9/6 Reebok cuts global president job as it reorganizes

Patrick decries fiscal cliff uncertainty

Governor Patrick said today he will cut executive branch spending by $225 million due to uncertainty about the looming fiscal cliff. (Boston Globe, 1:48 p.m.)
  • Mass. business confidence drops on 'fiscal cliff' concerns
  • Video Financial planning around the fiscal cliff
  • 12/3 Menino writes Obama, Boehner on fiscal cliff
  • What is the fiscal cliff, and what does it mean for you?
  • How Massachusetts will be affected by the fiscal cliff

Romney spotted stocking up at Costco

In another indignity forced upon him since losing the election, Mitt Romney was photographed during a Costco run near his California home. (Boston Globe, 2:07 p.m.)

Closing arguments underway in 2010 Mattapan massacre retrial of Moore

The defense told a jury today that Dwayne Moore is wrongly accused of being the triggerman behind the slayings that killed four people. (Boston Globe, 2:53 p.m.)
  • 12/3 Sole survivor in Mattapan massacre testifies in retrial
Cahill corruption trial

Defense: Lottery ads a public service, not for Timothy Cahill's political gain

Timothy P. Cahill's attorney said Cahill committed no crime, while a prosecutor said, "make no mistake: Tim Cahill wanted to be governor." (Globe , 12:20 p.m.)

Mitt Romney for mayor

Taxes must go up

It is impossible to envision a solution to the fiscal crisis that does not include those in the top 20 percent in income paying more taxes.

Opinion | Kevin Cullen

A life saved and lived well

When it ended after 92 years, Bob Muse’s life was a sweeping epic, but he would have told you his greatest accomplishment was getting an innocent man out of prison.

Headhunters are struggling to find enough talented engineers and developers for their Boston-area clients.

Bank of America to cut more jobs

Bank of America Corp., which is in the process of streamlining operations around the US, plans to eliminate nearly 200 jobs at two Mass. facilities next year.

Station a soapbox for free speech

Cambridge Community Television, which is approaching its 25th anniversary, has become known for a series featuring outspoken residents.

Typhoon Bopha kills at least 40 in Philippines
